title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement Ramiro Magno. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Contributing to eunis.habitats
text: outlines propose change eunis.habitats.

title: Contributing to eunis.habitats
text: can fix typos, spelling mistakes, grammatical errors documentation directly using GitHub web interface, long changes made source file. generally means ’ll need edit roxygen2 comments .R, .Rd file. can find .R file generates .Rd reading comment first line.

title: Contributing to eunis.habitats
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to eunis.habitats
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("patterninstitute/eunis.habitats", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. user-facing changes, add bullet top NEWS.md (.e. just first header). Follow style described https://style.tidyverse.org/news.html.

title: Contributing to eunis.habitats
text: use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Contributing to eunis.habitats
text: Please note eunis.habitats project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project agree abide terms.

title: Getting help
text: Thank using eunis.habitats! GitHub account, please file issue question bug report. GitHub account, can contact Ramiro Magno, maintainer package rmagno@pattern.institute.

title: Crosswalk of Habitat Codes
code: crosswalk(   code = c("A3.4", "A3.5"),   from = "EUNIS_2012",   to = "EUNIS_M_2022",   unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 64 × 2 #>    eunis_2012_code eunis_m_2022_code #>    <chr>           <chr>             #>  1 A3.4            MA133             #>  2 A3.4            MA134             #>  3 A3.4            MA135             #>  4 A3.4            MA136             #>  5 A3.4            MA137             #>  6 A3.4            MB13              #>  7 A3.4            MB131             #>  8 A3.4            MB1311            #>  9 A3.4            MB1312            #> 10 A3.4            MB1313            #> # ℹ 54 more rows

title: Crosswalk of Habitat Codes
code: crosswalk(   code = c("MH152", "MH2331"),   from = "EUNIS_M_2019",   to = "EUNIS_2012",   unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2019_code eunis_2012_code #>   <chr>             <chr>           #> 1 MH152             A7.12           #> 2 MH2331            A7.231

what: From EUNIS Marine 2022 to the European Red List of Habitats
title: Crosswalk of Habitat Codes
code: crosswalk(   code = c("MH152", "MH2331", "MA146", "MD55"),   from = "EUNIS_M_2022",   to = "RL",   unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2022_code rl_code #>   <chr>             <chr>   #> 1 MH152             NA      #> 2 MH2331            NA      #> 3 MA146             A1.1xx  #> 4 MD55              A5.27

title: Crosswalk of Habitat Codes
text: Note mappings one many, e.g. "MA12" EUNIS Marine 2019 maps following Habitats Directive Annex habitat codes: "8330", "1160", "1170" "1130". , default, column list-column. need use unnest = TRUE flatten table mappings convert list-column character vector column.
code: crosswalk(   code = c("M", "MA1", "MA11", "MA12"),   from = "EUNIS_M_2019",   to = "Annex_I" ) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2019_code annex_i_code #>   <chr>             <list>       #> 1 M                 <chr [1]>    #> 2 MA1               <chr [1]>    #> 3 MA11              <chr [1]>    #> 4 MA12              <chr [4]> crosswalk(   code = c("M", "MA1", "MA11", "MA12"),   from = "EUNIS_M_2019",   to = "Annex_I",   unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2019_code annex_i_code #>   <chr>             <chr>        #> 1 M                 NA           #> 2 MA1               NA           #> 3 MA11              NA           #> 4 MA12              8330         #> 5 MA12              1160         #> 6 MA12              1170         #> 7 MA12              1130

title: EUNIS Classification Systems
text: eunis_habitats data set comprises four habitat classifications: EUNIS classification 2007, revised 2012. EUNIS marine classification 2019. EUNIS marine classification 2022. EUNIS terrestrial classification 2021. column classification distinguishes : example, access level 1 marine habitats classified according EUNIS revision 2022 ("EUNIS_M_2022"): list ice habitats (level 2):
code: dplyr::distinct(eunis_habitats, classification) #> # A tibble: 4 × 1 #>   classification #>   <chr>          #> 1 EUNIS_2012     #> 2 EUNIS_M_2019   #> 3 EUNIS_M_2022   #> 4 EUNIS_T_2021 dplyr::filter(eunis_habitats, classification == "EUNIS_M_2022", level == 1L) #> # A tibble: 3 × 8 #>   classification section version group   level code  name            description #>   <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <int> <chr> <chr>           <chr>       #> 1 EUNIS_M_2022   marine  2022    benthic     1 M     Marine benthic… Marine ben… #> 2 EUNIS_M_2022   marine  2022    pelagic     1 MH    Pelagic water … The water … #> 3 EUNIS_M_2022   marine  2022    ice         1 MJ    Ice-associated… Sea ice, i… dplyr::filter(eunis_habitats,               classification == "EUNIS_M_2022",               group == "ice",               level == 2L) |>   dplyr::select("code", "name") #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   code  name              #>   <chr> <chr>             #> 1 MJ1   Sea ice           #> 2 MJ2   Freshwater ice    #> 3 MJ3   Brine channels    #> 4 MJ4   Under-ice habitat

title: EUNIS Habitat Classification
text: eunis.habitats R data package provides EUNIS habitat classification tidy format.

title: EUNIS Habitat Classification
text: Install CRAN:

title: EUNIS Habitat Classification
text: data set eunis_habitats provides four EUNIS classifications: EUNIS classification 2007, revised 2012. EUNIS marine classification 2019 EUNIS marine classification 2022 EUNIS terrestrial classification 2021 See vignette("eunis-classification") learn .

title: EUNIS Habitat Classification
text: Use helper crosswalk() map habitat codes across classification systems: EUNIS habitat classifications European Red List Habitats Habitats Directive Annex See vignette("crosswalks") details.

title: Convert habitat codes — crosswalk
text: Convert (crosswalk) habitat codes , , following habitat classification systems: EUNIS habitat classification: "EUNIS_2012", "EUNIS_M_2019", "EUNIS_M_2022" "EUNIS_T_2021". See eunis_habitats habitat codes, names descriptions. European Red List Habitats: "RL". Habitats Directive Annex : "Annex_I". Note pairwise combinations available. possibilities originally provided EUNIS raw data.

title: Convert habitat codes — crosswalk
text: code character vector habitat codes. values existing codes classification system indicated parameter. source classification system. one : "EUNIS_2012", "EUNIS_M_2019", "EUNIS_M_2022", "EUNIS_T_2021", "RL" "Annex_I". target classification system. Also, one options indicated parameter description. unnest Whether unnest "" column output. Note unnest number rows output (potentially) greater number habitat codes provided parameter code, meaning one--many crosswalks one row .

title: Convert habitat codes — crosswalk
text: tibble two variables codes, respectively. actual column names vary according specific crosswalk queried, see Examples.

title: Convert habitat codes — crosswalk
code: # From EUNIS 2012 to EUNIS Marine 2022 crosswalk(   code = c("A3.4", "A3.5"),   from = "EUNIS_2012",   to = "EUNIS_M_2022",   unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 64 × 2 #>    eunis_2012_code eunis_m_2022_code #>    <chr>           <chr>             #>  1 A3.4            MA133             #>  2 A3.4            MA134             #>  3 A3.4            MA135             #>  4 A3.4            MA136             #>  5 A3.4            MA137             #>  6 A3.4            MB13              #>  7 A3.4            MB131             #>  8 A3.4            MB1311            #>  9 A3.4            MB1312            #> 10 A3.4            MB1313            #> # ℹ 54 more rows  # From EUNIS Marine 2019 to EUNIS 2012 crosswalk( code = c("MH152", "MH2331"), from = "EUNIS_M_2019", to = "EUNIS_2012", unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 2 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2019_code eunis_2012_code #>   <chr>             <chr>           #> 1 MH152             A7.12           #> 2 MH2331            A7.231           # From EUNIS Marine 2022 to Red List crosswalk( code = c("MH152", "MH2331", "MA146", "MD55"), from = "EUNIS_M_2022", to = "RL", unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 4 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2022_code rl_code #>   <chr>             <chr>   #> 1 MH152             NA      #> 2 MH2331            NA      #> 3 MA146             A1.1xx  #> 4 MD55              A5.27    # From EUNIS Marine 2019 to Annex I crosswalk( code = c("M", "MA1", "MA11", "MA12"), from = "EUNIS_M_2019", to = "Annex_I", unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 7 × 2 #>   eunis_m_2019_code annex_i_code #>   <chr>             <chr>        #> 1 M                 NA           #> 2 MA1               NA           #> 3 MA11              NA           #> 4 MA12              8330         #> 5 MA12              1160         #> 6 MA12              1170         #> 7 MA12              1130          # From Annex I to EUNIS Marine 2019 crosswalk( code = c("8330", "1160"), from = "Annex_I", to = "EUNIS_M_2019", unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 966 × 2 #>    annex_i_code eunis_m_2019_code #>    <chr>        <chr>             #>  1 8330         MA12              #>  2 8330         MA127             #>  3 8330         MA1271            #>  4 8330         MA1272            #>  5 8330         MA1273            #>  6 8330         MA1274            #>  7 8330         MA1275            #>  8 8330         MA1276            #>  9 8330         MA12761           #> 10 8330         MA1277            #> # ℹ 956 more rows  # From EUNIS Terrestrial 2021 to Annex I crosswalk( code = c("U51", "U72", "Q25"), from = "EUNIS_T_2021", to = "Annex_I", unnest = TRUE ) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   eunis_t_2021_code annex_i_code #>   <chr>             <chr>        #> 1 U72               3250         #> 2 U72               3280         #> 3 U72               3290         #> 4 Q25               7140         #> 5 Q25               7130         #> 6 U51               NA            # From Annex I to EUNIS Terrestrial 2021 crosswalk(   code = c("91E0", "92A0", "9030"),   from = "Annex_I",   to = "EUNIS_T_2021", unnest = TRUE   ) #> # A tibble: 6 × 2 #>   annex_i_code eunis_t_2021_code #>   <chr>        <chr>             #> 1 92A0         T11               #> 2 92A0         T14               #> 3 9030         T12               #> 4 9030         T1C               #> 5 91E0         T11               #> 6 91E0         T12

title: eunis.habitats: EUNIS Habitat Classification — eunis.habitats-package
text: EUNIS habitat classification comprehensive pan-European system habitat identification https://www.eea.europa.eu/data--maps/data/eunis-habitat-classification-1. R data package providing EUNIS classification system. classification hierarchical covers types habitats natural artificial, terrestrial freshwater marine. habitat types identified specific codes, names descriptions come schema crosswalks habitat typologies.

title: eunis.habitats: EUNIS Habitat Classification — eunis.habitats-package
text: Maintainer: Ramiro Magno rmagno@pattern.institute (ORCID) contributors: Pedro Monteiro pmontei@ualg.pt (ORCID) [contributor] Luís Bentes lbentes@ualg.pt (ORCID) [contributor] Pattern Institute [copyright holder, funder] CCMAR [funder]

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: data set EUNIS habitats. row habitat. EUNIS habitat classification comprehensive pan-European system habitat identification. classification hierarchical covers types habitats natural artificial, terrestrial freshwater marine. habitat types identified specific codes, names descriptions come cross-walks habitat typologies. See crosswalk() mapping habitat classification systems.

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: tibble eight variables: classification Classification identifier. Identifies one four habitat classifications. section Component EUNIS classification: "marine" "terrestrial". version Classification version. group Habitat group. level Habitat level. code Habitat code. name Habitat name. description Habitat description.

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: https://www.eea.europa.eu/data--maps/data/eunis-habitat-classification-1

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: full list EUNIS habitats 2012: codes, scientific names revised descriptions. habitat descriptions EUNIS classification 2007 revised 2012. 2007 habitat types changed 2012 description revision mostly replaced Palaearctic UK Marine habitat classification codes used habitat descriptions levels 5 EUNIS classification equivalents. 2019 classification amended include two new habitats revised Resolution 4 Bern Convention adopted 38th Standing Committee meeting, November 2018. two habitats G3.4G Pinus sylvestris forest chalk steppe zone X36 Depressions (pody) Steppe zone.

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: revision EUNIS marine habitat classification published 2019. June 2021 classification complemented crosswalks Habitats Directive Annex European Red List Habitats. updated version published March 2022. Users change 2022 version earliest convenience.

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: review marine component EUNIS habitat classification initiated 2014. Marine benthic habitats, marine pelagic marine ice associated habitats separated three distinct groups, separate classification structure. first major division benthic marine part EUNIS classification based major biological zones (related depth) substrate type. Level 3 classification reflects main biogeographical regions Europe’s seas based distinct combinations salinity temperature regimes (Arctic, Baltic, Atlantic, Mediterranean Black Sea). first review published 2019 update version concerning mostly Atlantic regional sea available since March 2022. Crosswalks Habitats Directive Annex European Red List Habitats available crosswalks EUNIS marine habitats version 2012 regional seas apart Atlantic need revisited.

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
text: review terrestrial component EUNIS habitat classification initiated 2015. review concerns groups coastal habitats, grasslands, heathland, forest, sparsely vegetated vegetated man-made habitats. review updated January 2023 corrections existing groups inclusion wetlands additional crosslinks. remaining groups revised published later stage. classification includes cross-walks level 3 Habitats Directive Annex , European Red List Habitats, Bern Convention Resolution 4 habitats, MAES IUCN ecosystems, Corine Land Cover classes Euroveg Checklist 2016 Syntaxa. groups forest heathland include also crosswalks earlier revision groups published 2017. Habitats level 3 complemented lists characteristic species identified EVA database.

title: EUNIS Habitats — eunis_habitats
